question: Which of the following statements are true about <katex>$[NiCl_{4}]^{2-}$</katex>?
(a) The complex has tetrahedral geometry
(b) Co-ordination number of Ni is 2 and oxidation state is +4
(c) The complex is <katex>$sp^{3}$</katex> hybridised
(d) It is a high spin complex
(e) The complex is paramagnetic
explanation: In <katex>$[NiCl_{4}]^{2-}$</katex>, Ni is in +2 oxidation state with coordination number 4.
Cl is a weak field ligand, so no pairing occurs.
It is paramagnetic due to unpaired electrons.
